text: Hugh Todd Naylor Gaitskell (9 April 1906 – 18 January 1963) was a British politician, and leader of the Labour Party 1955–1963. He was also Chancellor of the Exchequer under Clement Attlee. He read Philosophy, Politics and Economics at New College, University of Oxford. After an academic career at University College London he became the MP for Leeds South in 1945. ==Other websites== * Category:1906 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Chancellors of the Exchequer Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs
title: Hugh Gaitskell
